attires.name: Pyjama
attires.description: Loose-fitting trousers, traditionally worn by men and women, often paired with a kurta or sherwani.

attires.name: Lungi
attires.description: A traditional garment, a length of cloth wrapped around the waist and legs, commonly worn by men in South India and Bengal.

attires.name: Dhoti
attires.description: A rectangular piece of unstitched cloth, wrapped around the waist and legs, worn by men, especially during religious ceremonies.

attires.name: Ghagra
attires.description: A long, pleated skirt worn by women, especially in Rajasthan and Gujarat, often paired with a choli and dupatta.

attires.name: Lehenga
attires.description: A long, embroidered skirt worn by women, often with a choli and dupatta, popular for weddings and festivals.

attires.name: Pavadai (Langa)
attires.description: A traditional South Indian skirt worn by girls and women, often paired with a blouse (choli).

attires.name: Saree
attires.description: A long, unstitched drape wrapped around the waist and over the shoulder, worn by women across India, often with a blouse and petticoat.

attires.name: Churidar
attires.description: A tightly fitting trouser worn by women, often paired with kameez or tunics, known for its gathered look at the ankles.

attires.name: Salwar
attires.description: A loose, pleated trouser that tapers at the ankle, commonly worn with kameez and dupatta by women across India.

attires.name: Palazzo Pants
attires.description: Wide-legged, flowing trousers popular among modern Indian women, often paired with kurtas or crop tops.

attires.name: Sharara
attires.description: A flared, wide-legged pant, usually worn with a short kurti and dupatta, popular for festive and wedding occasions.

attires.name: Patiala Salwar
attires.description: A voluminous, pleated trouser from Punjab, known for its comfort and style, usually paired with a short kameez.

attires.name: Jeggings
attires.description: A modern, stretchable legging that looks like jeans, popular among young women for casual and fusion wear.

attires.name: Harem Pants
attires.description: Loose, baggy pants with a dropped crotch, inspired by Middle Eastern styles and popular in Indian fusion fashion.
